title: email search
content: I used to be able to search for words in the subject lines of incoming emails. Why can't I do that anymore?
creator: gleime

title: thunderbird seems to run on ARM64 Is it OK
content: thunderbird seems to run on ARM64 Is it OK But I have seen articles that say it will not work. Should I Uninstall or continue using.
creator: chris.bartlett

title: Problems download my messages
content: I am receiving the following error message when downloading messages from AOL to Thunderbird. "The DELE command did not succeed. Error marking a message as deleted. Mail server pop.aol.com responded: Too many requests." Please could anyone help me download my messages? I have been away for a month, I have a lot of messages to download. Could that be causing the problem?
creator: knight134

title: Some email bodies shown as groups of ASCII characters separated by /
content:
Some emails show a message body that's nothing but / separated groups of ASCII characters, as for example "FJ/OHS/U7R/R3A/NT4/R03/0QY/T1N/VRC/WJ3/J6E/YXK/I6K/WNA..." continued for several pages. These are generally (but I think not always) obvious spam - that one has subject "Try Semaglutide and join the millions of women losing weight fast." But not all obvious spam is shown that way.

Is this something that Thunderbird is doing, or is the gibberish the actual message? I've only bee using Thunderbird for a few months, and don't recall seeing anything like it with my previous email program (Opera). I'm using version 115.7.0 (64-bit) on OpenSUSE Linux.
creator: jamesqf
